alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 9:14PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, northeastern Clarendon, northern Sumter and south central Kershaw Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Camden to near Timmonsville. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Bishopville, Lee State Park, Oakland, Woods Bay State Park, Sumter County Airport, Elliott, Mulberry, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Dalzell, Dinkins Mill, Manville, Spring Hill, Antioch, St. Charles, Wateree River Correctional Institution and Rembert. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 102 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 139 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
